turn.0: ELI5: Why do Narcoanalysis tests not used in every trial to speed up case resolutions worldwide?
turn.1: You're missing the forest for the trees...  I think intentionally.
turn.2: Which forest? What trees?  The color of anything is merely a cosmetic while we're discussing efficiency of two different work methods. Besides, battery acid doesn't have anything to do with grass. It is an electrolyte that stores power. Grass is merely a lifeform that utilizes photosynthesis to turn light into energy. Completely different things.
turn.3: And yet it can be said that grass is green because of the battery acid that is in it.  Doesn't make it correct, but it can be said.
turn.4: > Doesn't make it correct, but it can be said.   Yeah. So like I said, arguing for the sake of arguing and not to prove a point.
turn.5: You're projecting here.  My point in bringing it up in the first place is that you're arguing just to be arguing.
turn.6: I have been systematically refuting your points with paragraphs. You reply with illogical one liners.  Now - who is arguing for the sake for arguing?  If your answer is "You", then we were never on the same page to begin with and since we're not there yet either, we have wasted a lot of time and gotten absolutely nothing out of this discussion. Have a nice day.
turn.7: >we have wasted a lot of time and gotten absolutely nothing out of this discussion.  At least there is one thing we agree on.
